summary: Project "vibechat" is targeting a more strictly WhatsApp-like main navigation/UI (Chats, Groups, Status, Live, Videos) and removing prior advisory/help-style UI content from the authenticated in-app experience; the user also wants a lightweight introduction/onboarding screen shown before Internet Identity sign-in (pre-login) and now wants Vibechat to be installable as a PWA (add to home screen like a normal app). Additionally, the user requested social features: following/followers and liking.
architectural_notes: Platform constraint: authentication must use Internet Identity; SMS verification/phone-based login is not supported. Any in-app password is app-level data (e.g., for extra gating) and not a replacement for II auth.
Profile/registration UX: the "name" field should not require a full legal/real name; allow nicknames/handles and avoid copy implying otherwise.
Requested login UX should mimic WhatsApp where possible, but must still authenticate via Internet Identity (no SMS/phone-number login or verification).

Contacts integration requires explicit user permission and a privacy-forward UX; availability will vary by platform/browser (web vs mobile) and may require a fallback/manual contact discovery approach.
User requests WhatsApp-like parity; implement as "WhatsApp-like" UX/features within platform/legal constraints rather than a literal 1:1 copy.

WhatsApp message forwarding/bridging will require an official WhatsApp API integration (e.g., WhatsApp Business Platform) with significant policy/verification constraints; direct consumer WhatsApp message injection is generally not supported without approved APIs.

UI direction: prioritize a WhatsApp-like top-level navigation with sections in this order: Chats, Groups, Status, Live, Videos; de-emphasize/remove auxiliary advisory/help UI from the primary experience.

UX scope: user wants an introduction/onboarding screen before Internet Identity sign-in (pre-login). Keep the authenticated in-app experience WhatsApp-like and avoid bringing back advisory/help UI into the main navigation.
Pre-login intro/onboarding should remove advisory-style content and display user-provided welcome copy: "WELCOME TO VIBECHAT WHERE YOU WILL NEVER GET BORED..." — by Joshua Koech.

PWA scope: add web app manifest + required icons and enable service worker/caching so Vibechat can be installed ('Add to Home Screen') like a normal app; no change to Internet Identity auth requirement.

existing_features.title: Generate a custom, original logo image for the app name "vibechat" and add it to the project as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Display the Vibechat logo in the frontend UI in a sensible, consistent location (e.g., app header/top bar and/or landing view) and ensure it renders correctly on mobile and desktop.
Define and apply a cohesive visual theme for Vibechat (color palette, typography, spacing, and component styling) that complements the logo and is used consistently across existing screens.

Add a full-screen splash screen that appears on initial app load and prominently displays the existing Vibechat logo image (/assets/generated/vibechat-logo.dim_512x512.png), then smoothly dismisses to reveal the existing app UI.
Implement the splash screen in a reusable component and integrate it into the existing app entry layout so it can be toggled on/off via local React state without backend changes.
Fix any frontend build/type/lint errors that could block production publishing, including removing unused imports in the React codebase so the production build completes successfully.

Add a minimal backend “publish readiness” API that confirms the canister is callable (e.g., a query that returns the caller principal and a simple canister status string), and wire a small frontend UI section that calls it and displays the result in English.

Add a concise “How to publish” help section in the frontend UI with clear English instructions specific to publishing this app after a successful build, including a short troubleshooting note for deployment failures.
Promote the currently-live preview version of the Vibechat app to be the public production version so anyone can access it.

Add a frontend registration/profile screen that lets a logged-in user enter their name, phone number, and upload a profile picture, then saves the profile to the backend and shows success/error states in English.
Display the registered user’s profile summary in the app header when authenticated (at minimum: name and profile picture if set), and provide a clear way to open the profile editor from the header.
Update the frontend profile/registration dialog to allow a signed-in user to optionally set or change an in-app password, including basic validation and clear English success/error states.
Remove or revise any misleading frontend copy that implies phone-number SMS verification is performed, since SMS-based verification codes are not supported.

Update the profile UI so the name field is treated as a user-chosen display name (nicknames allowed), not a requirement for a full/legal/real name, and update all related user-facing copy and validation messages to reflect this in English.

Update the profile photo picker in the WhatsApp-style auth/profile flow to support selecting an image from the device photo gallery and (on supported mobile browsers) taking a new photo using the device camera, without requiring any backend changes.
Update the existing top app header to include a WhatsApp-like headline/title area (a clear, persistent app title next to the Vibechat logo) that remains visible on both mobile and desktop.

Add two far-end (right-aligned) header navigation/actions labeled "Live" and "Videos", placed at the far end of the app header similarly to WhatsApp-style top actions, without requiring any backend changes.

Add a Contacts sync UI that requests permission to read device contacts (when supported) and extracts phone numbers for matching registered Vibechat users, with a clear fallback flow for browsers that do not support contacts access.
Wire the Contacts sync UI to the backend using React Query hooks and display robust loading/error states in English.

Update the Vibechat UI to be WhatsApp-inspired (without copying WhatsApp’s exact branding/assets), including a dedicated Chats screen with a conversation list and a conversation detail view that feels familiar on mobile and desktop.
Add frontend chat functionality wired to the backend using React Query: conversation list, message list, and sending messages with optional photo/video attachments selected from the device.

Add an optional "Also share to WhatsApp" control in the chat message composer so that after a message is successfully sent in Vibechat, the app can open WhatsApp with the same text pre-filled using a WhatsApp share link (client-side).
Handle WhatsApp sharing limitations in the UI with clear English messaging, especially for media attachments.

Remove the current advisory/marketing-style landing experience and make the authenticated app experience start on a WhatsApp-like main navigation flow where the primary sections are: Chats, Groups, Status, Live, Videos (in that order).

Update the existing top navigation (AppHeader) to reflect WhatsApp-like section navigation: show actions/tabs for Chats, Groups, Status, Live, and Videos in that order; remove any non-essential navigation items that are not part of this WhatsApp-like top-level experience (e.g., do not show “Contacts” as a top-level item).
Add placeholder screens/views for Groups, Status, Live, and Videos so navigation works end-to-end, with clear English “Coming soon” messaging and no backend changes required.

Replace the current placeholder content in `frontend/src/pages/VideosPage.tsx` with a simple, scrollable “Sponsored” video feed that gives users something to watch, using frontend-only mock ad items (no backend changes).

Implement a basic in-app “watch” experience for the sponsored items in the Videos tab (e.g., tapping an item opens a modal/sheet with a full-bleed vertical viewer that simulates playback using an animated progress indicator and item details), entirely client-side.
Add a small disclaimer in the Videos tab UI clarifying that the sponsored items are sample/demo content (English), and ensure the layout works well on both mobile and desktop.
Add the required generated ad thumbnail images under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and render them in the Videos tab feed items (do not fetch thumbnails via the backend).

Add a new “AI” helper entry point in the Chats experience that provides AI-style assistance without calling any external AI/LLM services (e.g., a button near the message composer or in the conversation header that opens an assistant panel/sheet).

Implement “Smart Replies” suggestions for incoming messages using deterministic, client-side logic (rules/keyword matching/templates) and allow the user to insert a suggested reply into the message composer with one tap/click.

Add an optional “Rewrite” tool for the message composer that can transform the currently typed draft using client-side heuristics (e.g., “Shorter”, “More friendly”, “More formal”) and preview/apply the rewritten text.

Add clear, English user-facing disclosure copy wherever the AI helper is shown stating that the feature is a lightweight, on-device/demo assistant and does not use external AI services; ensure the copy does not imply real AI/LLM connectivity.
Add a lightweight pre-login introduction/onboarding experience that is shown to users before they sign in (Internet Identity), replacing the current pre-login landing/marketing content.
Provide a clear way to skip/dismiss the pre-login introduction and proceed to sign-in, and remember the dismissal locally so returning users are not forced to re-read the introduction every time.
Integrate the pre-login introduction into the existing app entry flow in `frontend/src/App.tsx` so that it appears only when the user is not authenticated, without requiring any backend changes.

Update the pre-login introduction screen (`frontend/src/pages/PreLoginIntroPage.tsx`) to remove the current advisory/feature marketing content and instead display only the following headline and attribution in English: Headline: "WELCOME TO VIBECHAT WHERE YOU WILL NEVER GET BORED..." Attribution: "by Joshua Koech". Keep a clear call-to-action to sign in (Internet Identity) and keep a way to skip/dismiss.

Remove the remaining unauthenticated advisory/marketing landing content by replacing the current `LandingPage` experience (`frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx`) with a minimal welcome view that uses the same welcome headline and attribution text ("WELCOME TO VIBECHAT WHERE YOU WILL NEVER GET BORED..." / "by Joshua Koech") and provides a clear button to sign in via the existing auth dialog flow. Ensure the unauthenticated experience no longer shows the previous marketing sections.

Add a Web App Manifest for Vibechat so modern browsers recognize the site as an installable PWA, including app name/short_name, start_url, display mode, theme/background colors, and icon declarations.
Update `frontend/index.html` to include the required PWA metadata: link to the manifest, theme-color meta tag, and appropriate icon links (including an Apple touch icon).

Add a service worker file to enable baseline PWA behavior (at minimum: registerable service worker and lightweight caching for core shell assets) without introducing runtime errors in unsupported browsers.

Register the service worker from within the editable React codebase (do not modify immutable files such as `frontend/src/main.tsx`) and ensure registration is performed only in production-like environments and supported browsers.
Add a simple, user-facing way for users to install Vibechat (PWA) from the unauthenticated experience, with clear English text explaining that installation availability depends on the browser/device.

new_feature_requests.summary: Design/create an app logo for vibechat
Add an app splash screen using the Vibechat logo
Publish Version 3 to production (run build + deploy sequence)
Add user registration flow collecting name, phone number, and profile picture
Implement backend user profile storage keyed by the caller Principal, supporting registration fields: full name, phone number, and profile picture.
Add an in-app password field/system as part of the user registration/profile flow (stored in backend; not SMS/phone-based auth)
Add backend support for an optional app-level password per user (keyed by caller Principal) that is stored securely and is never returned in any profile read APIs.
Relax profile name requirements: allow nicknames/non-real names and update any validation/copy accordingly
Make the login process UX almost similar to WhatsApp (while still using Internet Identity; no SMS-based phone login)
Enable photo/gallery access permission so users can select or take a profile picture (camera/gallery permissions and UX)
Add a WhatsApp-like headline/header in the app UI
Add far-end header/navigation items for "Live" and "Videos" (similar to WhatsApp)
Connect/sync device phone contacts (WhatsApp-like) so users can find/connect with contacts from their phone address book (requires contacts permission and privacy UX)
Implement a backend API to match a client-provided list of phone numbers to registered Vibechat user profiles without exposing the full user directory or admin-only phone-number lists.
Add support for chat media attachments: store/send photos and videos in conversations (message attachments)

Implement backend support for conversations and messages, including storing message text plus optional media attachments (photos/videos) associated with a conversation, with appropriate access control so only conversation participants can read or write messages and attachments.

Ensure message media storage uses the existing blob storage capability in the backend and that attachments can be retrieved by authorized participants via a safe, direct mechanism supported by the current blob abstractions.
Integrate Vibechat with WhatsApp so that when a user sends a message in Vibechat it can also be sent to WhatsApp (message forwarding/bridging)
Update the app’s main navigation to be WhatsApp-like with top-level sections ordered: Chats, Groups, Status, Live, Videos
Remove non-essential advisory/help content from the UI so the app experience matches a WhatsApp-like interface (focus on core tabs/screens)
Add a Groups section/screen (WhatsApp-like) alongside Chats and Status
Add a Status section/screen (WhatsApp-like) alongside Chats and Groups
Add ads or ad-like video content to the Videos section so it has something to watch (populate Videos tab with ads/monetizable content)
Add AI features to Vibechat (scope TBD: e.g., AI chat assistant, smart replies, or AI tools in Videos/Chats)
Add a pre-login introduction/onboarding screen shown before Internet Identity sign-in (intro to the app before sign in)
Update the pre-login introduction/onboarding screen copy to: "WELCOME TO VIBECHAT WHERE YOU WILL NEVER GET BORED..." with attribution "by Joshua Koech", and remove remaining advisory-style content
Make Vibechat installable as a PWA (manifest, icons, service worker) so users can add it to home screen like a normal app
Add following/followers functionality (social graph) so users can follow other users and view follower/following counts/lists
Add a liking feature (likes/reactions) so users can like content (e.g., status updates and/or videos) and view like counts
